gurmukhi: ੴ> ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ||
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of the divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੧ ਧ੍ਰੂ ਭਗਤ
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of the divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ਧ੍ਰੂ ਹਸਦਾ ਘਰਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਕਰਿ ਪਿਅਾਰੁ ਪਿੳੁ ਕੁਛੜਿ ਲੀਤਾ
transliteration: Dhr Hasadaa Ghari Aaiaa Kari Piaaru Piu Kouchharhi Leetaa.
translation: Boy Dhru came smiling to his house (palace) and his father full of love put him into his lap.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਹਹੁ ਪਕੜਿ ੳੁਠਾਲਿਅਾ ਮਨ ਵਿਚਿ ਰੋਸੁ ਮਤ੍ਰੇੲੀ ਕੀਤਾ
transliteration: Baaharu Pakarhi Outdaaliaa Man Vichi Rosu Matrayee Keetaa.
translation: Seeing this, the stepmother got angry and catching hold of his arm pushed him out of the lap of the father (the king).

gurmukhi: ਡੁਡਹੁਲਿਕਾ ਮਾਂ ਪੁਛੈ ਤੂੰ ਸਾਵਾਣੀ ਹੈ ਕਿ ਸੁਰੀਤਾ
transliteration: Dudahulikaa Maan Pouchhai Toon Saavaanee Hai Ki Sureetaa.
translation: Tearful with fear he asked his mother whether she was a queen or a maidservant?

gurmukhi: ਸਾਵਾਣੀ ਹਾਂ ਜਨਮ ਦੀ ਨਾਮੁ ਨ ਭਗਤੀ ਕਰਮਿ ਦ੍ਰਿੜ੍ਹੀਤਾ
transliteration: Saavaanee Haan Janam Dee Naamu N Bhagatee Karami Drirhheetaa.
translation: O son! (said she) I was born queen but I did not remember God and did not undertake acts of devotion (and this is the reason of yours and mine plight).

gurmukhi: ਕਿਸੁ ੳੁਦਮ ਤੇ ਰਾਜੁ ਮਿਲੈ ਸਤ੍ਰੂ ਤੇ ਸਭ ਹੋਵਨਿ ਮੀਤਾ
transliteration: Kisu Udam Tay Raaju Mili Satr Tay Sabhi Hovani Meetaa.
translation: With that effort can the kingdom be had (asked Dhru) and how can enemies turn friends?

gurmukhi: ਪਰਮੇਸਰੁ ਅਾਰਾਧੀਅੈ ਜਿਦੂ ਹੋੲੀਅੈ ਪਤਿਤ ਪੁਨੀਤਾ
transliteration: Paramaysaru Aaraadheeai Jidoo Hoeeai Patit Pouneetaa.
translation: The Lord should be worshipped and thus the sinners also become sacred ones (said the mother).

gurmukhi: ਬਾਹਰਿ ਚਲਿਅਾ ਕਰਣਿ ਤਪੁ ਮਨ ਬੈਰਾਗੀ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਤੀਤਾ
transliteration: Baahari Chaliaa Karani Tapu Man Bairaagee Hoi Ateetaa.
translation: Listening to this and getting totally detached in his mind Dhru went out (to the jungle) to undertake rigorous discipline.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਰਦ ਮੁਨਿ ੳੁਪਦੇਸਿਅਾ ਨਾਮ ਨਿਧਾਨੁ ਅਮਿਓ ਰਸੁ ਪੀਤਾ
transliteration: Naarad Mouni Oupadaysiaa Naau Nidhaanu Amiao Rasu Peetaa.
translation: On the way, sage Narad taught him the technique of devotion and Dhru quaffed the nectar from the ocean of the Name of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਛਹੁੰ ਰਾਜੇ ਸਦਿਅਾ ਅਬਿਚਲ ਰਾਜ ਕਰਹੁ ਨਿਤ ਨੀਤਾ
transliteration: Pichhahu Raajay Sadiaa Abichalu Raaju Karahu Nit Neetaa.
translation: (After some time) King (Uttanpad) called him back and asked him (Dhru) to rule forever.

gurmukhi: ਹਾਰਿ ਚਲੇ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਜਗਜੀਤਾ ||੧||
transliteration: Haari Chalay Guramoukhi Jag Jeetaa ?1?
translation: The gurmukhs who seem to be losing i.e. who turn their faces from the evil propensities, conquer the world.

gurmukhi: ੨ ਪ੍ਹਲਾਦ ਭਗਤ
translation: Prahlad

gurmukhi: ਘਰਿ ਹਰਣਾਖਸ ਦੈਤ ਦੇ ਕਲਰਿ ਕਵਲੁ ਭਗਤੁ ਪ੍ਹਿਲਾਦੁ
transliteration: Ghari Haranaakhas Dait Day Kalari Kavalu Bhagatu Prahilaadu.
translation: Prahlad, the saint, was born in the house of demon (king) Haranakhas like a lotus is born in the alkaline (barren) land.

gurmukhi: ਪੜ੍ਹਨ ਪਠਾੲਿਅਾ ਚਾਟਸਾਲ ਪਾਂਧੈ ਚਿਤਿ ਹੋਅਾ ਅਹਿਲਾਦੁ
transliteration: Parhhan Patdaaiaa Chaatasaal Paandhay Chiti Hoaa Ahilaadu.
translation: When he was sent to seminary, the brahmin purohit became elated (because the king’s son was now his disciple).

gurmukhi: ਸਿਮਰੈ ਮਨ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮ ਗਾਵੈ ਸਬਦੁ ਅਨਾਹਦ ਨਾਦੁ
transliteration: Simarai Man Vichi Raam Naam Gaavai Sabadu Anaahadu Naadu.
translation: Prahlad would remember the name of Ram in his heart and outwardly also he would eulogise the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤਿ ਕਰਨਿ ਸਭ ਚਾਟੜੈ ਪਾਂਧੇ ਹੋੲੇ ਰਹੇ ਵਿਸਮਾਦੁ
transliteration: Bhagati Karani Sabh Chaatarhai Paandhay Hoi Rahay Visamaadu.
translation: Now all the disciples became devotees of Lord, which was an awful and embarrassing situation for all the teachers.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜੇ ਪਾਸਿ ਰੂਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਦੋਖੀ ਦੈਤਿ ਵਧਾੲਿਅਾ ਵਾਦੁ
transliteration: Raajay Paasi Rooaaiaa Dokhee Daiti Vadhaaiaa Vaadu.
translation: The priest (teacher) reported or complained to the king (that O king your son has become devotee of God).

gurmukhi: ਜਲ ਅਗਨੀ ਵਿਚਿ ਘਤਿਅਾ ਜਲੈ ਨ ਡੁਬੈ ਗੁਰ ਪਰਸਾਦਿ
transliteration: Jal Aganee Vichi Ghatiaa Jalai N Doubai Gur Parasaadi.
translation: The malevolent demon picked up the quarrel. Prahlad was thrown into fire and water but with the grace of Guru (the Lord) neither he was burnt nor drowned.

gurmukhi: ਕਢਿ ਖੜਗੁ ਸਦਿ ਪੁਛਿਅਾ ਕੳੁਣੁ ਸੁ ਤੇਰਾ ਹੈ ੳੁਸਤਾਦੁ
transliteration: Karhi Kharhagu Sadi Pouchhiaa Kaounu Su Tayraa Hai Ousataadu.
translation: Angered as he was, Hiranyaksyapu took out his double-edged sword and asked Prahlad who his Guru (Lord) was.

gurmukhi: ਥੰਮ੍ਹੁ ਪਾੜਿ ਪਰਗਟਿਅਾ ਨਰਸਿੰਘ ਰੂਪ ਅਨੂਪ ਅਨਾਦਿ
transliteration: Danmh Paarhi Paragatiaa Narasingh Roop Anoop Anaadi.
translation: At the same moment Lord God in the form of man-lion came out of pillar. His form was grand and majestic.

gurmukhi: ਬੇਮੁਖ ਪਕੜਿ ਪਛਾੜਿਅਨੁ ਸੰਤ ਸਹਾੲੀ ਅਾਦਿ ਜੁਗਾਦਿ
transliteration: Baymakh Pakarhi Pachhaarhianu Sant Sahaaee Aadi Jougaadi.
translation: That wicked demon was thrown down and killed and thus it was proved that the Lord is kind to devotees since the time immemorial.

gurmukhi: ਜੈ ਜੈ ਕਾਰ ਕਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮਾਦਿ ||੨||
transliteration: Jai Jai Kaar Karani Brahamaadi ?2?
translation: Seeing this Brahma and other gods started eulogising the Lord.

gurmukhi: ੩ ਰਾਜਾ ਬਲਿ
translation: Bali, the king

gurmukhi: ਬਲਿ ਰਾਜਾ ਘਰਿ ਅਾਪਣੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਬੈਠਾ ਜਗੁ ਕਰਾਵੈ
transliteration: Bali Raajaa Ghari Aapanai Andari Baitdaa Jagi Karaavai.
translation: Bali, the king, was busy in performing a yajna in his palace.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਵਨ ਰੂਪੀ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਚਾਰਿ ਵੇਦ ਮੁਖਿ ਪਾਠ ਸੁਣਾਵੈ
transliteration: Baavan Roopee Aaiaa Chaari Vayd Moukhi Paatd Sounaavai.
translation: A low stature dwarf in the form of brahmin came there reciting all the four Vedas.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜੇ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸਦਿਅਾ ਮੰਗ ਸੁਅਾਮੀ ਜੋ ਤੁਧੁ ਭਾਵੈ
transliteration: Raajay Andari Sadiaa Mangu Suaamee Jo Tudhu Bhaavai.
translation: The king after calling him in asked him to demand anything he liked.

gurmukhi: ਅਛਲੁ ਛਲਣਿ ਤੁਧੁ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਸੁਕ੍ਰ ਪੁਰੋਹਿਤੁ ਕਹਿ ਸਮਝਾਵੈ
transliteration: Achhalu Chhalani Tudhu Aaiaa Soukr Purohitu Kahi Samajhaavai.
translation: Immediately priest Sukracharya made the king (Bali) understand that he (the beggar) is undeceivable God and He had came to delude him.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੳੁ ਅਢਾੲੀ ਧਰਤਿ ਮੰਗਿ ਪਿਛਹੁ ਦੇ ਤ੍ਹਿੁ ਲੋਅ ਨ ਮਾਵੈ
transliteration: Karau Addhaaee Dharati Mangi Pichhahu Day Trihu Loa N Maavai.
translation: The dwarf demanded two and half steps length of earth (which was granted by the king).

gurmukhi: ਦੁੲਿ ਕਰਵਾਂ ਕਰਿ ਤਿੰਨ ਲੋਅ ਬਲਿ ਰਾਜਾ ਲੈ ਮਗਰੁ ਮਿਣਾਵੈ
transliteration: Dui Karavaan Kari Tinn Loa Bali Raajaa Lai Magaru Minaavai.
translation: Then the dwarf expanded his body so much that now the three worlds were insufficient for him.

gurmukhi: ਬਲਿ ਛਲਿ ਅਾਪੁ ਛਲਾੲਿਅਨੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਦੲਿਅਾਲੁ ਮਿਲੈ ਗਲਿ ਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Bali Chhali Aapu Chhalaaianu Hoi Daiaalu Milai Gali Laavai.
translation: Even knowing this deception Bali allowed himself to be deceived so, and seeing this Vishnu embraced him.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਤਾ ਰਾਜੁ ਪਤਾਲ ਦਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਧੀਨੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਜਸੁ ਗਾਵੈ
transliteration: Ditaa Raaju Pataal Daa Hoi Adheenu Bhagati Jasu Gaavai.
translation: When he covered the three worlds in two steps, for third half-step king Bali offered his own back.

gurmukhi: ਹੋੲਿ ਦਰਵਾਨ ਮਹਾਂ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਵੈ ||੩||
transliteration: Hoi Daravaan Mahaan Soukhu Paavai ?3?
translation: Bali was given the kingdom of the netherworld where surrendering to God he engaged himself in the loving devotion of the Lord. Vishnu was delighted to be the doorkeeper of Bali.

gurmukhi: ੪ ਅੰਬਰੀਕ ਭਗਤੀ
translation: Ambaris

gurmukhi: ਅੰਬਰੀਕ ਮੁਹਿ ਵਰਤੁ ਹੈ ਰਾਤਿ ਪੲੀ ਦੁਰਬਾਸਾ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Anbareek Muhi Varatu Hai Raati Paee Durabaasaa Aaiaa.
translation: One evening while king Ambaris was fasting he was visited by sage Durvasa

gurmukhi: ਭੀੜਾ ਓਸੁ ੳੁਪਾਰਣਾ ਓਹੁ ੳੁਠਿ ਨ੍ਹਾਵਣਿ ਨਦੀ ਸਿਧਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bheerhaa Aosu Oupaaranaa Aohu Outdi Nhaavani Nadee Sidhaaiaa.
translation: The king was to break his fast while serving Durvasa but the rishi went to the riverbank to take a bath.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣੋਦਕੁ ਲੈ ਪੋਖਿਅਾ ਓਹੁ ਸਰਾਪੁ ਦੇਵਣ ਨੋ ਧਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Charanodaku Lai Pokhiaa Aohu Saraapu Dayn No Dhaaiaa.
translation: Fearing the change of date (which would deem his fast fruitless), the king broke his fast by drinking the water which he had poured on the feet of the rishi. When the rishi realised that the king had not served him first, he ran to curse the king.

gurmukhi: ਚਕ੍ਰ ਸੁਦਰਸਨੁ ਕਾਲ ਰੂਪ ਹੋੲਿ ਭੀਹਾਵਲੁ ਗਰਬੁ ਗਵਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Chakr Sudarasanu Kaal Roop Hoi Bheehaavalu Garabu Gavaaiaa.
translation: On this, Vishnu ordered his death like disc to move towards Durvasa  and thus the ego of Durvasa was removed.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਮ੍ਹਣੁ ਭੰਨਾ ਜੀੳੁ ਲੈ ਰਖਿ ਨ ਹੰਘਨਿ ਦੇਵ ਸਬਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Baamhanu Bhannaa Jeeu Lai Rakhi N Hanghani Dayv Sabaaiaa.
translation: Now Brahmin Durvasa ran for his life. Even the gods and deities could not afford him shelter.

gurmukhi: ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਲੋਕੁ ਸਿਵ ਲੋਕੁ ਤਜਿ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਲੋਕੁ ਬੈਕੁੰਠ ਤਜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Indr Loku Siv Loku Taji Braham Loku Baikountd Tajaaiaa.
translation: He was avoided in the abodes of Indra, Siva, Brahma and the heavens.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵਤਿਅਾਂ ਭਗਵਾਨ ਸਣੁ ਸਿਖਿ ਦੇੲਿ ਸਭਨਾਂ ਸਮਝਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dayvatiaan Bhagavaanu Sanu Sikhi Dayi Sabhanaan Samajhaaiaa.
translation: Gods and God made him understand (that none except Ambaris could save him).

gurmukhi: ਅਾੲਿ ਪੲਿਅਾ ਸਰਣਾਗਤੀ ਮਾਰੀਦਾ ਅੰਬਰੀਕ ਛੁਡਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aai Paiaa Saranaagatee Maareedaa Anbareek Chhudaaiaa.
translation: Then he surrendered before Ambaris and Ambaris saved the dying sage.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤਿ ਵਛਲੁ ਜਗਿ ਬਿਰਦ ਸਦਾੲਿਅਾ ||੪||
transliteration: Bhagati Vachhalu Jagi Biradu Sadaaiaa ?4?
translation: The Lord God came to be known in the world as benevolent to devotees.

gurmukhi: ੫ ਰਾਜਾ ਜਨਕ
translation: King Janak

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤੁ ਵਡਾ ਰਾਜਾ ਜਨਕੁ ਹੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਵਿਚਿ ੳੁਦਾਸੀ
transliteration: Bhagatu Vadaa Raajaa Janaku Hai Guramoukhi Maaiaa Vichi Udaasee.
translation: King Janak was a great saint who amidst maya remained indifferent to it.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵ ਲੋਕ ਨੋ ਚਲਿਅਾ ਗਣ ਗੰਧਰਬ ਸਭਾ ਸੁਖਵਾਸੀ
transliteration: Dayv Lok No Chaliaa Gan Gandharaboo Sabhaa Soukhavaasee.
translation: Along with gans and gandharvs (calestial musicians) he went to the abode of the gods.

gurmukhi: ਜਮਪੁਰਿ ਗੲਿਅਾ ਪੁਕਾਰ ਸੁਣਿ ਵਿਲਲਾਵਨਿ ਜੀਅ ਨਰਕ ਨਿਵਾਸੀ
transliteration: Jamapuri Gaiaa Poukaar Souni Vilalaavini Jeea Narak Nivaasee.
translation: From there, he, hearing the cries of inhabitants of hell, went to them.

gurmukhi: ਧਰਮਰਾੲਿ ਨੋ ਅਾਖਿਓਨੁ ਸਭਨਾਂ ਦੀ ਕਰਿ ਬੰਦ ਖਲਾਸੀ
transliteration: Dharam Raai No Aakhiaonu Sabhanaa Dee Kari Band Khalaasee.
translation: He asked the god of death, Dharamrai, to relieve all their suffering.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੇ ਬੇਨਤੀ ਧਰਮਰਾੲਿ ਹੳੁ ਸੇਵਕ ਠਾਕੁਰੁ ਅਬਿਨਾਸੀ
transliteration: Karay Baynatee Dharamaraai Hau Sayvaku Tdaakuru Abinaasee.
translation: Hearing this, the god of death told him he was a mere servant of the eternal Lord (and without His orders he could not liberate them).

gurmukhi: ਗਹਿਣੇ ਧਰਿਅਨੁ ੲੇਕ ਨਾੳੁ ਪਾਪਾ ਨਾਲਿ ਕਰੈ ਨਿਰਜਾਸੀ
transliteration: Gahinay Dhariaonu Iku Naau Paapaa Naali Karai Nirajaasee.
translation: Janak offered a part of his devotion and remembrance of the name of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਸੰਗਿ ਪਾਪੁ ਨ ਪੁਜਨੀ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਨਾੳੁ ਅਤੁਲ ਨ ਤੁਲਾਸੀ
transliteration: Paasangi Paapu N Pujanee Guramoukhi Naau Atul N Tulaasee.
translation: All the sins of hell were found not equal even to the counterweight of balance.

gurmukhi: ਨਰਕਹੁੰ ਛੁਟੇ ਜੀਅ ਜੰਤ ਕਟੀ ਗਲਹੁੰ ਸਿਲਕ ਜਮ ਫਾਸੀ
transliteration: Narakahu Chhoutay Jeea Jant Katee Galahoun Silak Jam Dhaasee.
translation: In fact no balance can weigh the fruits of recitation and remembrance of the Lords name by the gurmukh.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਕਤਿ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਨਾਵੈ ਦੀ ਦਾਸੀ ||੫||
transliteration: Moukati Jougati Naavai Dee Daasee ?5?
translation: All the creatures got liberated from hell and the noose of death was cut.  Liberation and the technique of attaining it are the servants of the name of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਹਰੀ ਚੰਦ ਤੇ ਤਾਰਾ ਰਾਣੀ
translation: Harischandar and queen Taramati

gurmukhi: ਸੁਖੁ ਰਾਜੇ ਹਰੀ ਚੰਦ ਘਰਿ ਨਾਰਿ ਸੁ ਤਾਰਾ ਲੋਚਨ ਰਾਣੀ
transliteration: Soukhu Raajay Haree Chand Ghari Naari Su Taaraa Lochan Raanee.
translation: King HariChand had a queen with beautiful eyes, Tara, who had made his home the abode of comforts.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਗਾਵਦੇ ਰਾਤੀ ਜਾੲਿ ਸੁਣੈ ਗੁਰਬਾਣੀ
transliteration: Saadh Sangati Mili Gaavaday Raatee Jaai Sounai Gurabaanee.
translation: At night she would go to the place where in the form of holy congregation, would recite the holy hymns.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਛੈ ਰਾਜਾ ਜਾਗਿਅਾ ਅਧੀ ਰਾਤਿ ਨਿਖੰਡਿ ਵਿਹਾਣੀ
transliteration: Pichhai Raajaa Jaagiaa Adhee Raati Nikhandi Vihaanee.
translation: After she had left, the King awoke in the middle of the night and realised she had gone.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਣੀ ਦਿਸਿ ਨ ਅਾਵੲੀ ਮਨ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਰਤ ਗੲੀ ਹੈਰਾਣੀ
transliteration: Raanee Disi N Aavaee Man Vichi Varati Gaee Hairaanee.
translation: He could not find the Queen anywhere and his heart filled with astonishment

gurmukhi: ਹੋਰਤੁ ਰਾਤੀ ੳੁਠਿ ਕੈ ਚਲਿਅਾ ਪਿਛੈ ਤਰਲ ਜੁਅਾਣੀ
transliteration: Horatu Raatee Outdi Kai Chaliaa Pichhai Taral Juaanee.
translation: The following night he followed the young queen.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਣੀ ਪਹੁਤੀ ਸੰਗਤੀ ਰਾਜੇ ਖੜੀ ਖੜਾੳੁ ਨੀਸਾਣੀ
transliteration: Raanee Pahoutee Sangatee Raajay Kharhee Kharhaau Neesaanee.
translation: The queen reached the holy congregation and the King lifted one of her sandals from there (so that he could prove the infidelity of the queen).

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਅਾਰਾਧਿਅਾ ਜੋੜੀ ਜੁੜੀ ਖੜਾੳੁ ਪੁਰਾਣੀ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Aaraadhiaa Jorhee Jurhee Kharhaau Puraanee.
translation: When about to go, the queen concentrated upon the holy congregation and the one sandal became a pair.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜੇ ਡਿਠਾ ਚਲਿਤੁ ੲਿਹੁ ੲੇਹ ਖੜਾਵ ਹੈ ਚੋਜ ਵਿਡਾਣੀ
transliteration: Raajay Ditdaa Chalitu Ihu Ayh Kharhaav Hai Doj Vidaanee.
translation: The king upheld this feat and realized that there her matching sandal was a miracle.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਟਹੁ ਕੁਰਬਾਣੀ ||੬||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Vitahu Kurabaanee ?6?
translation: I am sacrifice unto the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ੭ ਬਿਦਰ ਅਰ ਦੁਰਜੋਧਨ
translation: Vidur and Duryodhan

gurmukhi: ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਸੁਣਿਅਾ ਬਿਦਰ ਦੇ ਬੋਲੈ ਦੁਰਜੋਧਨੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਰੁਖਾ
transliteration: Aaiaa Souniaa Bidar Day Bolai Durajodhanu Hoi Roukhaa.
translation: Hearing that Lord Krishan was served and stayed over at humble Bidar's home, Duryodhan remarked sarcastically.

gurmukhi: ਘਰਿ ਅਸਾਡੇ ਛਡਿ ਕੈ ਗੋਲੇ ਦੇ ਘਰਿ ਜਾਹਿ ਕਿ ਸੁਖਾ
transliteration: Ghari Asaaday Chhadi Kai Golay Day Ghari Jaahi Ki Soukhaa.
translation: Leaving our grand palaces, how much happiness and comfort did you attain in the home of a servant?

gurmukhi: ਭੀਖਮੁ ਦ੍ਰੋਣਾ ਕਰਣ ਤਜਿ ਸਭਾ ਸੀਗਾਰ ਵਡੇ ਮਾਨੁਖਾ
transliteration: Bheekhamu Dronaa Karan Taji Sabhaa Seegaar Vaday Maanoukhaa.
translation: You gave up even Bhikhaum, Dohna and Karan who are recognised as great men who are adorned in all courts.

gurmukhi: ਝੁੰਗੀ ਜਾੲਿ ਵਲਾੲਿਓਨ ਸਭਨਾ ਦੇ ਜੀਅ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਧੁਖਾ
transliteration: Jhoungee Jaai Valaaiaonu Sabhanaa Day Jeea Andari Dhoukhaa.
translation: We have all been anguished to find that you have lived in a hut”.

gurmukhi: ਹਸਿ ਬੋਲੇ ਭਗਵਾਨ ਜੀ ਸੁਣਿਹੋ ਰਾਜਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਨਮੁਖਾ
transliteration: Hasi Bolai Bhagavaan Jee Souniho Raajaa Hoi Sanamoukhaa.
translation: Then smilingly, Lord Krishan asked the King to come forward and to listen carefully.

gurmukhi: ਤੇਰੇ ਭਾੳੁ ਨ ਦਿਸੲੀ ਮੇਰੇ ਨਾਹੀ ਅਪਦਾ ਦੁਖਾ
transliteration: Tayray Bhaau N Disaee Mayray Naahee Apadaa Doukhaa.
translation: I see no love and devotion in you (and hence I have not come to you).

gurmukhi: ਭਾੳੁ ਜਿਵੇਹਾ ਬਿਦਰ ਦੇ ਹੋਰੀ ਦੇ ਚਿਤਿ ਚਾੳੁ ਨ ਚੁਖਾ
transliteration: Bhaau Jivayhaa Bidar Day Horee Day Chiti Chaau N Choukhaa.
translation: No heart I see has even a fraction of the love that Bidar bears in his heart.

gurmukhi: ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਦਾ ਭੁਖਾ ||੭||
transliteration: Gobind Bhaau Bhagati Daa Bhoukhaa ?7?
translation: The Lord needs loving devotion and nothing else.

gurmukhi: ੮ ਦ੍ਰੋਪਤੀ
translation: Draupadi

gurmukhi: ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸਭਾ ਦੁਸਾਸਣੈ ਮਥੇਵਾਲ ਦ੍ਰੋਪਤੀ ਅਾਂਦੀ
transliteration: Andari Sabhaa Dousaasanai Madayvaali Dropatee Aandee.
translation: Dragging Daropati by the hair, Dusasanai brought her into the assembly.

gurmukhi: ਦੂਤਾ ਨੋ ਫੁਰਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਨੰਗੀ ਕਰਹੁ ਪੰਚਾਲੀ ਬਾਂਦੀ
transliteration: Dootaa Nay Phuramaaiaa Nagee Karahu Panchaalee Baandee.
translation: He commanded his men to strip the maidservant Dropati stark naked.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਜੇ ਪਾਂਡੋ ਵੇਖਦੇ ਅੳੁਘਟਿ ਰੁਧੀ ਨਾਰਿ ਜਿਨ੍ਹਾਂ ਦੀ
transliteration: Panjay Paando Vaykhaday Aoughati Rudhee Naari Jinaa Dee.
translation: All the five Pandavs who she was the wife of, beheld this.

gurmukhi: ਅਖੀ ਮੀਟਿ ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ਧਰਿ ਹਾਹਾ ਕ੍ਰਿਸਨ ਕਰੈ ਬਿਲਲਾਂਦੀ
transliteration: Akhee Meet Dhiaanu Dhari Haahaa Krisan Karai Bilalaandee.
translation: Crying, totally dejected and helpless, she closed her eyes. Single-mindedly she invoked Krishna for help.

gurmukhi: ਕਪੜ ਕੋਟੁ ੳੁਸਾਰਿਓਨੁ ਥਕੇ ਦੂਤ ਨ ਪਾਰਿ ਵਸਾਂਦੀ
transliteration: Kaparh Kotu Ousaariaonu Dakay Doot N Paari Vasaandee.
translation: The servants were taking off the clothes from her body but more layers of clothes formed a fort around her; the servants got tired but the layers of clothes were never ending.

gurmukhi: ਹਥ ਮਰੋੜਨਿ ਸਿਰ ਧੁਣਨਿ ਪਛੋਤਾਨਿ ਕਰਨਿ ਜਾਹਿ ਜਾਂਦੀ
transliteration: Had Marorhani Siru Dhounani Pachhotaani Karani Jaahi Jaandee.
translation: The servants were now writhing and frustrated on their abortive attempt and felt that they themselves were ashamed.

gurmukhi: ਘਰਿ ਅਾੲੀ ਠਾਕੁਰ ਮਿਲੇ ਪੈਜ ਰਹੀ ਬੋਲੇ ਸ਼ਰਮਾਂਦੀ
transliteration: Ghari Aaee Tdaakur Milay Paij Rahee Bolay Saramaandee.
translation: On reaching home, Dropati was asked by Lord Krishna whether she was saved in the assembly.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਥ ਅਨਾਥਾਂ ਬਾਣਿ ਧੁਰਾਂਦੀ ||੮||
transliteration: Naad Anaadaan Baani Dhuraandee ?8?
translation: She shyly replied, “Since perennial times you are living up to your reputation of being father of the fatherless ones.”

gurmukhi: ੯ ਸੁਦਾਮਾ ਭਗਤ
translation: Sudama

gurmukhi: ਬਿਪ ਸੁਦਾਮਾ ਦਾਲਿਦੀ ਬਾਲ ਸਖਾੲੀ ਮਿਤ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਸਦਾੲੇ
transliteration: Bipu Sudaamaa Daalidee Baal Sakhaaee Mitr Sadaaay.
translation: Sudama, a poor brahman, was known to be a friend of Krishna from childhood.

gurmukhi: ਲਾਗੂ ਹੋੲੀ ਬਾਮ੍ਹਣੀ ਮਿਲਿ ਜਗਦੀਸ ਦਲਿਦ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਗਵਾੲੇ
transliteration: Laagoo Hoee Baamhanee Mili Jagadees Dalidr Gavaaay.
translation: His brahmin wife always pestered him as to why he did not go to Lord Krishna to alleviate his poverty.

gurmukhi: ਚਲਿਅਾ ਗਣਦਾ ਗਟੀਅਾਂ ਕਿੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਜਾੲੀਅੈ ਕੳੁਣੁ ਮਿਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Chaliaa Ganadaa Gateeaan Kiu Kari Jaaeeai Kaounu Milaaay.
translation: He was perplexed and pondered over how he could get re-introduced to Krishna, who could help him meet the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਪਹੁਤਾ ਨਗਰਿ ਦੁਅਾਰਕਾ ਸਿੰਘ ਦੁਅਾਰਿ ਖਲੋਤਾ ਜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Pahoutaa Nagari Duaarakaa Singh Duaari Khalotaa Jaaay.
translation: He reached the town of Duaraka and stood before the main gate (of the palace of Krishna).

gurmukhi: ਦੂਰਹੁੰ ਦੇਖਿ ਡੰਡੳੁਤ ਕਰਿ ਛਡਿ ਸਿੰਘਾਸਣੁ ਹਰਿ ਜੀ ਅਾੲੇ
transliteration: Doorahu Daykhi Dandaouti Kari Chhadi Singhaasanu Hari Jee Aaay.
translation: Seeing him from a distance, Krishna, the Lord, bowed and leaving his throne came to Sudama.

gurmukhi: ਪਹਿਲੇ ਦੇ ਪਰਦਖਣਾ ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਕੇ ਲੈ ਗਲਿ ਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Pahilay Day Paradakhanaa Pairee Pai Kay Lai Gali Laaay.
translation: First he circumambulated around Sudama and then touching his feet he embraced him.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣੋਦਕੁ ਲੈ ਪੈਰ ਧੋੲਿ ਸਿੰਘਾਸਣੁ ੳੁਤੇ ਬੈਠਾੲੇ
transliteration: Charanodaku Lai Pair Dhoi Singhaasanu Outay Baitdaaay.
translation: Washing his feet he took that water and made Sudama sit on the throne.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਛੇ ਕੁਸਲੁ ਪਿਅਾਰੁ ਕਰਿ ਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਾ ਦੀ ਕਥਾ ਸੁਣਾੲੇ
transliteration: Pouchhay Kousalu Piaaru Kari Gur Sayvaa Dee Kadaa Sounaaay.
translation: Then Krishna lovingly enquired about his welfare and talked about the time when they were together in the service of the guru (Sandipani).

gurmukhi: ਲੈ ਕੈ ਤੰਦੁਲ ਚਬਿਓਨੁ ਵਿਦਾ ਕਰੇ ਅਗੈ ਪਹੁਚਾੲੇ
transliteration: Lai Kay Tandul Chabiaonu Vidaa Karay Agai Pahouchaavai.
translation: Krishna asked for the rice sent by Sudama’s wife and after eating, came out to see off his friend Sudama.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਸਕੁਚਿ ਪਠਾੲੇ ||੯||
transliteration: Chaari Padaarad Sakouchi Patdaaay ?9?
translation: Though all the four boons (righteousness,wealth,fulfillment of desire and libereation) were given to Sudama by Krishna, Krishna's humbleness still made him feel totally helpless.

gurmukhi: ੧੦ ਜੈਦੇੳੁ ਭਗਤ
translation: Jaidev

gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਭਗਤਿ ਜੈਦੇੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਗੀਤ ਗੋਵਿੰਦ ਸਹਜ ਧੁਨਿ ਗਾਵੈ
transliteration: Praym Bhagati Jaidayu Kari Geet Govind Sahaj Dhouni Gaavai.
translation: Getting immersed in the loving devotion, the devotee Jaidev would sing the songs of the Lord (Govind).

gurmukhi: ਲੀਲ੍ਹਾ ਚਲਿਤ ਵਖਾਣਦਾ ਅੰਤਰਜਾਮੀ ਠਾਕੁਰ ਭਾਵੈ
transliteration: Leelaa Chalit Vakhaanadaa Antarajaamee Tdaakur Bhaavai.
translation: He would describe the glorious feats accomplished by God and was greatly loved by him.

gurmukhi: ਅਖਰ ੲਿਕੁ ਨ ਅਾਵੜੈ ਪੁਸਤਕੁ ਬੰਨ੍ਹਿ ਸੰਧਿਅਾ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Akharu Iku N Aavarhai Pousatak Bannhi Sandhiaa Kari Aavai.
translation: He (Jaidev) knew no would and hence binding his book would return home in the evening.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਣ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਘਰਿ ਅਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਭਗਤ ਰੂਪਿ ਲਿਖਿ ਲੇਖੁ ਬਣਾਵੈ
transliteration: Goun Nidhaanu Ghari Aai Kai Bhagat Roopi Likhi Laykhu Banaavai.
translation: God, the repository of all virtues in the form of the devotee Himself wrote all the songs for him.

gurmukhi: ਅਖਰ ਪੜ੍ਹਿ ਪਰਤੀਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਵਿਸਮਾਦੁ ਨ ਅੰਗਿ ਸਮਾਵੈ
transliteration: Akhar Parhhi Parateeti Kari Hoi Visamaadu N Angi Samaavai.
translation: Jaidev would get elated seeing and reading those words.

gurmukhi: ਵੇਖੈ ਜਾੲਿ ੳੁਜਾੜਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਬਿਰਖੁ ੲਿਕੁ ਅਾਚਰਜ ਸੁਹਾਵੈ
transliteration: Vaykhai Jaai Ujaarhi Vichi Birakhu Iku Aacharaju Suhaavai.
translation: Jaidev saw a wonderful tree in the deep forest.

gurmukhi: ਗੀਤ ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਸੰਪੂਰਣੋ ਪਤਿ ਪਤਿ ਲਿਖਿਅਾ ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Geet Govind Sanpoorano Pati Pati Likhiaa Antu N Paavai.
translation: Each and every leaf had the songs of the Lord Govind written on it. He could not understand this mystery.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤਿ ਹੇਤਿ ਪਰਗਾਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਦੲਿਅਾਲੁ ਮਿਲੈ ਗਲਿ ਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Bhagati Hayti Paragaasu Kari Hoi Daiaalu Milai Gali Laavai.
translation: Due to the love for the devotee, God embraced him in person.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਤ ਅਨੰਤ ਨ ਭੇਦ ਗਣਾਵੈ ||੧੦||
transliteration: Sant Anat N Bhaydu Ganaavai ?10?
translation: God and saint have no veil in between.

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ਨਾਮਦੇਵ
translation: Namdev

gurmukhi: ਕੰਮ ਕਿਤੈ ਪਿੳੁ ਚਲਿਅਾ ਨਾਮਦੇੳੁ ਨੋ ਅਾਖਿ ਸਿਧਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Kanm Kitay Piu Chaliaa Naamadayu No Aakhi Sidhaaiaa.
translation: Namdev's father was called to do some work so he called Naamdev.

gurmukhi: ਠਾਕੁਰ ਦੀ ਸੇਵਾ ਕਰੀਂ ਦੁਧੁ ਪੀਅਾਵਣੁ ਕਹਿ ਸਮਝਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Tdaakur Dee Sayvaa Karee Dudhu Peeaavanu Kahi Samajhaaiaa.
translation: He told Namdev to serve Thakur, the Lord, with milk.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮਦੇੳੁ ੲਿਸਨਾਨੁ ਕਰਿ ਕਪਲ ਗਾੲਿ ਦੁਹਿ ਕੈ ਲੈ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Naamadayu Isanaanu Kari Kapal Gaai Duhi Kai Lay Aaiaa.
translation: After taking bath Namdev brought the milk of black-teat cow.

gurmukhi: ਠਾਕੁਰ ਨੋ ਨ੍ਹਾਵਾਲਿਕੈ ਚਰਣੋਦਕੁ ਲੈ ਤਿਲਕੁ ਚੜ੍ਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Tdaakur No Nhaavaali Kai Charanodaku Lai Tilaku Charhhaaiaa.
translation: Having bathed the Thakur, he put the water used to wash the Thakur, on his own head.

gurmukhi: ਹਥਿ ਜੋੜਿ ਬਿਨਤੀ ਕਰੈ ਦੂਧੁ ਪੀਅਹੁ ਜੀ ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Hadi Jorhi Binatee Karai Dudhu Peeahu Jee Gobind Raaiaa.
translation: Now with folded hands he requested the Lord to have milk.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਹਚੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਰਾਧਿਅਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਦੲਿਅਾਲੁ ਦਰਸੁ ਦਿਖਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Nihachau Kari Aaraadhiaa Hoi Daiaalu Darasu Dikhalaaiaa.
translation: Becoming steadfast in his thoughts when he prayed, the Lord appeared before him in person.

gurmukhi: ਭਰੀ ਕਟੋਰੀ ਨਾਮਦੇਵਿ ਲੈ ਠਾਕੁਰ ਨੋ ਦੂਧ ਪੀਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bharee Katoree Naamadayvi Lai Tdaakur No Dudhu Peeaaiaa.
translation: Namdev made Lord drink the full bowl of milk.

gurmukhi: ਗਾੲਿ ਮੁੲੀ ਜੀਵਾਲਿਓਨੁ ਨਾਮਦੇੳੁ ਦਾ ਛਪਰ ਛਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gaai Muee Jeevaaliaonu Naamadayv Daa Chhaparu Chhaaiaa.
translation: On another occasion God brought a dead cow to life and also thatched the hut of Namdev.

gurmukhi: ਫੇਰਿ ਦੇਹੁਰਾ ਰਖਿਓਨੁ ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਨ ਲੈ ਪੈਰੀ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dhayri Dayhuraa Rakhiaonu Chaari Varan Lai Pairee Paaiaa.
translation: On yet another occasion, God rotated the temple (after Naamdev was not allowed entrance) and made all the four castes (varnas) bow at the feet of Namdev.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤ ਜਨਾ ਦਾ ਕਰੇ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧੧||
transliteration: Bhagat Janaa Daa Karay Karaaiaa ?11?
translation: The Lord accomplishes whatever is done and desired by saints.

gurmukhi: ੧੨ ਨਾਮਦੇਵ ਅਰ ਤ੍ਰਿਲੋਚਨ
translation: Namdev and Trilochan

gurmukhi: ਦਰਸਨੁ ਵੇਖਣ ਨਾਮਦੇਵ ਭਲਕੇ ੳੁਠਿ ਤ੍ਰਿਲੋਚਨ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Darasanu Daykhan Naamadayv Bhalakay Outdi Trilochanu Aavai.
translation: Trilochan awoke early daily just to have sight of Namdev,

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤਿ ਕਰਨਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਦੁੲਿ ਜਣੇ ਨਾਮਦੇੳੁ ਹਰਿ ਚਲਿਤੁ ਸੁਣਾਵੈ
transliteration: Bhagati Karani Mili Dui Janay Naamadayu Hari Chalitu Sounaavai.
translation: Together they would concentrate on the Lord and Namdev would tell him the grand stories of God.

gurmukhi: ਮੇਰੀ ਭੀ ਕਰਿ ਬੇਨਤੀ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਦੇਖਾਂ ਜੇ ਤਿਸੁ ਭਾਵੈ
transliteration: Mayree Bhee Kari Baynatee Darasanu Daykhaan Jay Tisu Bhaavai.
translation: (Trilochan asked Namdev) “kindly pray for me so that if the Lord accepts, I may also have a glimpse of His blessed vision.”

gurmukhi: ਠਾਕੁਰ ਜੀ ਨੋ ਪੁਛਿਓਸੁ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਕਿਵੈ ਤ੍ਰਿਲੋਚਨੁ ਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Tdaakur Jee No Pouchhiaosu Darasanu Kivai Trilochanu Paavai.
translation: Namdev asked Thakur, the Lord, as to how Trilochan could have sight of the Lord ?

gurmukhi: ਹਸਿਕੈ ਠਾਕੁਰ ਬੋਲਿਅਾ ਨਾਮਦੇੳੁ ਨੋ ਕਹਿ ਸਮਝਾਵੈ
transliteration: Hasi Kai Tdaakur Boliaa Naamadayu No Kahi Samajhaavai.
translation: The Lord God smiled and explained to Naamdev;

gurmukhi: ਹਥਿ ਨ ਅਾਵੈ ਭੇਟੁ ਸੋ ਤੁਸਿ ਤ੍ਰਿਲੋਚਨ ਮੈ ਮੁਹਿ ਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Hadi N Aavai Bhaytu So Tousi Trilochan Mai Muhi Laavai.
translation: “No offerings are needed by me.  Out of my delight only, I would make Trilochan to have sight of me. "

gurmukhi: ਹੳੁ ਅਧੀਨੁ ਹਾਂ ਭਗਤ ਦੇ ਪਹੁੰਚਿ ਨ ਹੰਘਾਂ ਭਗਤੀ ਦਾਵੈ
transliteration: Hau Adheenu Haan Bhagat Day Pahounchi N Hanghaan Bhagatee Daavai.
translation: I am under the total control of the devotees and their loving claims I can never reject; rather I myself also cannot understand them.

transliteration: Hoi Vicholaa Aani Milaavai ?12?
translation: Their loving devotion, in fact, becomes mediator and makes them meet me.”

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਧੰਨਾ ਅਤੇ ਬ੍ਰਾਹਮਨ
translation: Dhanna and brahmin

gurmukhi: ਬਾਮ੍ਹਣ ਪੂਜੈ ਦੇਵਤੇ ਧੰਨਾ ਗੳੂ ਚਰਾਵਣ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Baamhanu Poojai Dayvatay Dhannaa Gaoo Charaavani Aavai.
translation: A brahman would worship gods (in the form of stone idols) where Dhanna used to graze his cow.

gurmukhi: ਧੰਨੈ ਡਿਠਾ ਚਲਿਤੁ ੲੇਹੁ ਪੁਛੈ ਬਾਮ੍ਹਣੁ ਅਾਖਿ ਸੁਣਾਵੈ
transliteration: Dhannai Ditdaa Chalitu Ayhu Poochhai Baamhanu Aakhi Sounaavai.
translation: On seeing his worship, Dhanna asked the brahman what he was doing.

gurmukhi: ਠਾਕੁਰ ਦੀ ਸੇਵਾ ਕਰੈ ਜੋ ੲਿਛੈ ਸੋੲੀ ਫਲੁ ਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Tdaakur Dee Sayvaa Karay Jo Ichhai Soee Phalu Paavai.
translation: “Service to the Thakur (God) gives the desired fruit,” replied the brahman.

gurmukhi: ਧੰਨਾ ਕਰਦਾ ਜੋਦੜੀ ਮੈ ਭਿ ਦੇਹ ੲਿਕ ਜੇ ਤੁਧੁ ਭਾਵੈ
transliteration: Dhannaa Karadaa Jodarhee Mai Bhi Dayh Ik Jay Tudhu Bhaavai.
translation: Dhanna requested, “O brahman, if you agree kindly give one to me.”

gurmukhi: ਪਥਰੁ ੲਿਕ ਲਪੇਟਿ ਕਰਿ ਦੇ ਧੰਨੈ ਨੋ ਗੈਲ ਛੁਡਾਵੈ
transliteration: Padaru Iku Lapayti Kari Day Dhannai No Gail Chhudaavai.
translation: The brahman rolled a stone, gave it to Dhanna and thus got rid of him.

gurmukhi: ਠਾਕੁਰ ਨੋ ਨ੍ਹਾਵਾਲਿਕੈ ਛਾਹਿ ਰੋਟੀ ਲੈ ਭੋਗੁ ਚੜ੍ਹਾਵੈ
transliteration: Tdaakur No Nhaavaali Kai Chhaahi Rotee Lai Bhogu Charhhaavai.
translation: Dhanna bathed the Thakur and offered him bread and buttermilk.

gurmukhi: ਹਥਿ ਜੋੜਿ ਮਿਨਤਾਂ ਕਰੈ ਪੈਰੀਂ ਪੈ ਪੈ ਬਹੁਤ ਮਨਾਵੈ
transliteration: Hadi Jorhi Minati Karai Pairee Pai Pai Bahoutu Manaavai.
translation: With folded hands and falling at the feet of the stone he begged for his service to be accepted.

gurmukhi: ਹੳੁਂ ਭੀ ਮੁਹੁ ਨ ਜੁਠਾਲਸਾਂ ਤੂ ਰੁਠਾ ਮੈ ਕਿਹੁ ਨ ਸੁਖਾਵੈ
transliteration: Hau Bhee Muhu N Joutdaalasaan Too Routdaa Mai Kihu N Soukhaavai.
translation: Dhanna said, “I will also not eat because how can I be happy if you are annoyed.”

gurmukhi: ਗੋਸਾੲੀ ਪਰਤਖਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਰੋਟੀ ਖਾੲਿ ਛਾਹਿ ਮੁਹਿ ਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Gosaaee Paratakhi Hoi Rotee Khaahi Chhaahi Muhi Laavai.
translation: (Seeing his true and loving devotion) God was forced to appear and eat his bread and buttermilk.

transliteration: Bholaa Bhaau Gobindu Milaavai ?13?
translation: In fact, innocence like that of Dhanna makes the sight of the Lord available.

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ਬੇਣੀ ਭਗਤ
translation: Beni

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਬੇਣੀ ਭਗਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਜਾੲਿ ੲਿਕਾਂਤ ਬਹੈ ਲਿਵ ਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Baynee Bhagati Kari Jaai Ikaantu Bahai Liv Laavai.
translation: Saint Beni, a gurmukh, used to sit in solitude and would enter a meditative trance.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਮ ਕਰੈ ਅਧਿਅਾਤਮੀ ਹੋਰਸੁ ਕਿਸੈ ਨ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾਵੈ
transliteration: Karam Karai Adhiaatamee Horasu Kisai N Alakhu Lakhaavai.
translation: He would perform spiritual activities and in humbleness would never tell anyone.

gurmukhi: ਘਰਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਜਾ ਪੁਛੀਅੈ ਰਾਜੁ ਦੁਅਾਰਿ ਗੲਿਅਾ ਅਾਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Ghari Aaiaa Jaa Pouchheeai Raaj Duaari Gaiaa Aalaavai.
translation: Reaching back home when asked, he would tell people that he had gone to the door of his king (the Supreme Lord).

gurmukhi: ਘਰਿ ਸਭ ਵਥੂ ਮੰਗੀਅਨਿ ਵਲ ਛਲੁ ਕਰਿ ਕੈ ਝਤੁ ਲੰਘਾਵੈ
transliteration: Ghari Sabh Vadoo Mangeeani Valu Chhalu Kari Kai Jhat Laghaavai.
translation: When his wife asked for some household material he would avoid her and thus spend his time performing spiritual activities.

gurmukhi: ਵਡਾ ਸਾਂਗੁ ਵਰਤਦਾ ਓਹ ੲਿਕ ਮਨਿ ਪਰਮੇਸਰੁ ਧਿਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Vadaa Saangu Varatadaa Aoh Ik Mani Paramaysaru Dhiaavai.
translation: One day while concentrating on the Lord with single-minded devotion, a strange miracle happened.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਜ ਸਵਾਰੈ ਭਗਤ ਦੀ ਰਾਜਾ ਹੁੲਿ ਕੈ ਘਰਿ ਚਲਿ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Paij Savaarai Bhagat Dee Raajaa Hoi Kai Ghari Chali Aavai.
translation: To keep the glory of the devotee, God Himself in the form of King went to his house.

gurmukhi: ਦੇੲਿ ਦਿਲਾਸਾ ਤੁਸਿਕੈ ਅਣਗਣਤੀ ਖਰਚੀ ਪਹੁੰਚਾਵੈ
transliteration: Dayi Dilaasaa Tousi Kai Anaganatee Kharachee Pahounchaavai.
translation: In great joy, He consoled everyone and made available profuse money for expenditure.

gurmukhi: ਓਥਹੁੰ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਭਗਤ ਪਾਸਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਦੲਿਅਾਲੁ ਹੇਤੁ ੳੁਪਜਾਵੈ
transliteration: Aodahu Aaiaa Bhagati Paasi Hoi Daiaalu Haytu Oupajaavai.
translation: From there He came to His devotee Beni and compassionately loved him.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤ ਜਨਾਂ ਜੈਕਾਰੁ ਕਰਾਵੈ ||੧੪||
transliteration: Bhagat Janaan Jaikaaru Karaavai ?14?
translation: This way He arranges applause for His devotees.

gurmukhi: ੧੫ ਕਬੀਰ ਅਤੇ ਰਾਮਾਨੰਦ
translation: Kabir and Ramanand

gurmukhi: ਹੋੲਿ ਬਿਰਕਤੁ ਬਨਾਰਸੀ ਰਹਿੰਦਾ ਰਾਮਾਨੰਦੁ ਗੁਸਾੲੀਂ
transliteration: Hoi Birakatu Banaarasee Rahindaa Raamaanadu Gousaaeen.
translation: Being detached from the world, Brahmin Ramanand lived in Varanasi (Kasi).

gurmukhi: ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਵੇਲੇ ੳੁਠਿ ਕੈ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਗੰਗਾ ਨ੍ਹਾਵਣ ਤਾੲੀਂ
transliteration: Anmritu Vaylay Outdi Kai Jaandaa Gangaa Nhaavan Taaeen.
translation: He would rise early in the morning and go to the Ganges to bathe.

gurmukhi: ਅਗੋ ਹੀ ਦੇ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਲੰਮਾ ਪਿਅਾ ਕਬੀਰ ਤਿਥਾੲੀਂ
transliteration: Ago Hee Day Jaai Kai Lamaa Piaa Kabeer Tidaaeen.
translation: Once even before Ramanand, Kabir went there and lay in the way.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਟੁੰਬ ੳੁਠਾਲਿਅਾ ਬੋਲਹੁ ਰਾਮ ਸਿਖ ਸਮਝਾੲੀ
transliteration: Pairee Tounbi Outdaaliaa Bolahu Raam Sikh Samajhaaee.
translation: Touching with his feet Ramanand awakened Kabir and told him to speak ‘Ram’, the true spiritual teaching.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਲੋਹਾ ਪਾਰਸੁ ਛੁਹੇ ਚੰਦਨ ਵਾਸੁ ਨਿੰਮੁ ਮਹਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Jiu Lohaa Paarasu Chhuhay Chandan Vaasu Nimu Mahakaaee.
translation: As the iron touched by philosopher’s stone becomes gold and the margosa tree (Azadirachta indica) is made fragrant by sandal.

gurmukhi: ਪਸੂ ਪਰੇਤਹੁ ਦੇਵ ਕਰਿ ਪੂਰੇ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਦੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Pasoo Paraytahu Dayv Kari Pooray Satigur Dee Vadiaaee.
translation: The wondrous Guru turns even animals and ghosts into angels.

gurmukhi: ਅਚਰਜ ਨੋ ਅਚਰਜੁ ਮਿਲੈ ਵਿਸਮਾਦੈ ਵਿਸਮਾਦੁ ਮਿਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Acharaj No Acharaju Milai Visamaadai Visamaadu Milaaee.
translation: Meeting the wonderous Guru the disciple wonderfully merges into the great wonderous Lord.

gurmukhi: ਝਰਣਾ ਝਰਦਾ ਨਿਝਰਹੁੰ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਬਾਣੀ ਅਘੜ ਘੜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Jharanaa Jharadaa Nijharahu Guramoukhi Baanee Agharh Gharhaaee.
translation: Then from the Self springs a fountain and the words of the gurmukhs shape a beautiful form

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮ ਕਬੀਰੈ ਭੇਦੁ ਨ ਭਾੲੀ ||੧੫||
transliteration: Raam Kabeerai Bhaydu N Bhaaee ?15?
translation: Now Ram and Kabir became identical.

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ਸੈਨ ਨਾੲੀ
translation: Sain, The barber

gurmukhi: ਸੁਣਿ ਪਰਤਾਪੁ ਕਬੀਰ ਦਾ ਦੂਜਾ ਸਿਖ ਹੋਅਾ ਸੈਣੁ ਨਾੲੀ
transliteration: Souni Parataapu Kabeer Daa Doojaa Sikhu Hoaa Sainu Naaee.
translation: Hearing of glory of Kabir, Sain also turned to be a disciple.

gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਰੇਮਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਰਾਤੀ ਕਰੈ ਭਲਕੈ ਰਾਜ ਦੁਅਾਰੈ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Praym Bhagati Raatee Karai Bhalakai Raaj Duaarai Jaaee.
translation: In the night he would immerse in loving devotion and in the morning he would serve at the door of the king.

gurmukhi: ਅਾੲੇ ਸੰਤ ਪਰਾਹੁਣੇ ਕੀਰਤਨੁ ਹੋਅਾ ਰੈਣਿ ਸਬਾੲੀ
transliteration: Aaay Sant Paraahounay Keeratanu Hoaa Raini Sabaaee.
translation: On one night some sadhus came to him and the whole night was spent in singing the Lord's praises

gurmukhi: ਛਡਿ ਨ ਸਕੈ ਸੰਤ ਜਨ ਰਾਜ ਦੁਅਾਰਿ ਨ ਸੇਵ ਕਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Chhadi N Sakai Sant Jan Raaj Duaari N Sayv Kamaaee.
translation: Sain could not leave company of the saints and consequently did not perform the king’s service the following morning.

gurmukhi: ਸੈਣ ਰੂਪਿ ਹਰਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਰਾਣੈ ਨੋ ਰੀਝਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sain Roopi Hari Jaai Kai Aaiaa Raanai No Reejhaaee.
translation: God himself took the form of Sain. He served the king in such a way that the king was overjoyed.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧ ਜਨਾਂ ਨੋ ਵਿਦਾ ਕਰਿ ਰਾਜ ਦੁਅਾਰਿ ਗੲਿਅਾ ਸਰਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Saadh Janaan No Vidaa Kari Raaj Duaari Gaiaa Saramaaee.
translation: Bidding fairwell to the saints, Sain hesitantly arrived at the palace of the king.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਣੈ ਦੂਰਹੁੰ ਸਦਿਕੈ ਗਲਹੁੰ ਕਵਾੲਿ ਖੋਲ੍ਹਿ ਪੈਨ੍ਹਾੲੀ
transliteration: Raanai Doorahoun Sadi Kai Galahoun Kavaai Kholi Painhaaee.
translation: The king From a distance the king called him nearby. He took off his own robes and offered them to Bhagat Sain.

gurmukhi: ਵਸਿ ਕੀਤਾ ਹੳੁਂ ਤੁਧੁ ਅਜੁ ਬੋਲੈ ਰਾਜ ਸੁਣੈ ਲੁਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Vasi Keetaa Haoun Tudhu Aju Bolai Raajaa Sounai Loukaaee.
translation: ‘You have overpowered me’, said the king and his words were heard by one and all.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਗਟੁ ਕਰੈ ਭਗਤਿ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Paragatu Karai Bhagati Vadiaaee ?16?
translation: God himself manifests the grandeur of the devotee.

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਰਵਿਦਾਸ ਭਗਤ
translation: Ravidas

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤੁ ਭਗਤੁ ਜਗਿ ਵਜਿਅਾ ਚਹੁੰ ਚਕਾਂ ਦੇ ਵਿਚਿ ਚਮਿਰੇਟਾ
transliteration: Bhagatu Bhagatu Jagi Vajiaa Chahu Chakaan Day Vichi Chamiraytaa.
translation: The tanner (Ravidas) became renowned as bhagat (saint) in all the four directions.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਣ੍ਹਾ ਗੰਢੈ ਰਾਹ ਵਿਚਿ ਕੁਲਾ ਧਰਮ ਢੋੲਿ ਢੋਰ ਸਮੇਟਾ
transliteration: Paanhaa Ganddhai Raah Vichi Kulaa Dharam Ddhoi Ddhor Samaytaa.
translation: In accordance with his family tradition he would cobble the shoes and carry away the dead animals.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਮੈਲੈ ਚੀਥੜੈ ਹੀਰਾ ਲਾਲ ਅਮੋਲੁ ਪਲੇਟਾ
transliteration: Jiu Kari Mailay Cheedarhay Heeraa Laalu Amolu Palaytaa.
translation: This was his outward routine but in reality he was a gem wrapped in rags.

gurmukhi: ਚਹੁੰ ਵਰਨਾ ੳੁਪਦੇਸਦਾ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ਕਰਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਸਹੇਟਾ
transliteration: Chahu Varanaa Oupadaysadaa Giaan Dhiaanu Kari Bhagati Sahaytaa.
translation: He would preach all the four varnas (castes).  His preaching made them rapt in the meditative devotion for the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਨ੍ਹਾਵਣਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਸੰਗੁ ਮਿਲਿ ਬਾਨਾਰਸ ਕਰਿ ਗੰਗਾ ਥੇਟਾ
transliteration: Nhaavani Aaiaa Sangu Mili Baanaaras Kari Gangaa Daytaa.
translation: Once, a group of people went to Kasi (Varanasi) to have their sacred dip in the Ganges.

gurmukhi: ਕਢਿ ਕਸੀਰਾ ਸੳੁਪਿਅਾ ਰਵਿਦਾਸੈ ਗੰਗਾ ਦੀ ਭੇਟਾ
transliteration: Kaddhi Kaseeraa Saoupiaa Ravidaasai Gangaa Dee Bhaytaa.
translation: Ravidas gave one dhela (half a pice) to one member and asked him to offer it to the Ganges.

gurmukhi: ਲਗਾ ਪੁਰਬੁ ਅਭੀਚ ਦਾ ਡਿਠਾ ਚਲਿਤੁ ਅਚਰਜ ਅਮੇਟਾ
transliteration: Lagaa Purabu Abheech Daa Ditdaa Chalitu Acharaju Amaytaa.
translation: A great festival of Abhijit naksatr (star) was on there where the public saw this wonderful episode.

gurmukhi: ਲੲਿਅਾ ਕਸੀਰਾ ਹਥੁ ਕਢਿ ਸੂਤੁ ੲਿਕੁ ਜਿੳੁ ਤਾਣਾ ਪੇਟਾ
transliteration: Laiaa Kaseeraa Hadu Kaddhi Sootu Iku Jiu Taanaa Paytaa.
translation: Ganges, herself taking out her hand accepted that paltry amount, dhela, and proved that Ravidas was one with Ganges as warp and weft.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤ ਜਨਾਂ ਹਰਿ ਮਾਂ ਪਿੳੁ ਬੇਟਾ ||੧੭||
transliteration: Bhagat Janaan Hari Maan Piu Baytaa ?17?
translation: For bhagats (saints,) God is their mother, father and son all in one.

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਅਹਿੱਲਿਅਾ ਅਤੇ ਗੋਤਮ
translation: Ahalya and Gautam

gurmukhi: ਗੋਤਮ ਨਾਰਿ ਅਹਿਲਿਅਾ ਤਿਸਨੋ ਦੇਖਿ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਲੋਭਾਣਾ
transliteration: Gotam Naari Ahiliaa Tisano Daykhi Indr Lobhaanaa.
translation: Ahalya was wife of Gautam.  But when she set eyes Indhar, the king of gods, lust overpowered her.

gurmukhi: ਪਰ ਘਰਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਸਰਾਪੁ ਲੈ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਹਸ ਭਗ ਪਛੋਤਾਣਾ
transliteration: Par Ghari Jaai Saraapu Lai Hoi Sahas Bhag Pachhotaanaa.
translation: He entered their house, got curse of being with thousands of pudendums and repented.

gurmukhi: ਸੁੰਞਞਞਞਾ ਹੋਅਾ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਲੋਕੁ ਲੁਕਿਅਾ ਸਰਵਰ ਮਨਿ ਸਰਮਾਣਾ
transliteration: Sounaa Hoaa Indr Loku Loukiaa Saravari Mani Saramaanaa.
translation: The Indralok (abode of Indr) became desolate and getting ashamed of himself he hid in a pond.

gurmukhi: ਸਹਸ ਭਗਹੁ ਲੋੲਿਣ ਸਹਸ ਲੈਂਦੋੲੀ ੲਿੰਦ ਪੁਰੀ ਸਿਧਾਣਾ
transliteration: Sahas Bhagahu Loin Sahas Laindoee Indr Puree Sidhaanaa.
translation: On revocation of the curse when all those holes became eyes, only then he returned to his habitat.

gurmukhi: ਸਤੀ ਸਤਹੁ ਟਲਿ ਸਿਲਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਨਦੀ ਕਿਨਾਰੈ ਬਾਝੁ ਪਰਾਣਾ
transliteration: Satee Satahu Tali Silaa Hoi Nadee Kinaarai Baajhu Paraanaa.
translation: Ahalya who could not remain steadfast in her chastity became stone and remained lying on the river bank

gurmukhi: ਰਘੁਪਤਿ ਚਰਣ ਛੁਹੰਦਿਅਾਂ ਚਲੀ ਸੁਰਗ ਪੁਰਿ ਬਣੇ ਬਿਬਾਣਾ
transliteration: Raghoupati Charani Chhuhandiaa Chalee Surag Puri Banay Bibaanaa.
translation: Touching the (holy) feet of Ram she was lifted to the heavens.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤ ਵਛਲ ਭਲਿਅਾੲੀਅਹੁੰ ਪਤਿਤ ੳੁਧਾਰਣੁ ਪਾਪ ਕਮਾਣਾ
transliteration: Bhagati Vachhalu Bhaliaaeeahu Patit Udhaaranu Paap Kamaanaa.
translation: Because of His benevolence He is mother-like to the devotees and being forgiver of the sinners He is called redeemer of the fallen ones.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਣ ਨੋ ਗੁਣ ਸਭ ਕੋ ਕਰੈ ਅੳੁਗੁਣ ਕੀਤੇ ਗੁਣ ਤਿਸੁ ਜਾਣਾ
transliteration: Goun No Goun Sabh Ko Karai Aougoun Keetay Goun Tisu Jaanaa.
translation: Doing good is returned by good gestures always, but he who does good to the evil is known as virtuous.

gurmukhi: ਅਬਿਗਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਕਿਅਾ ਅਾਖਿ ਵਖਾਣਾ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Abigati Gati Kiaa Aakhi Vakhaanaa ?18?
translation: How can I explain the greatness of that unmanifest (Lord).

gurmukhi: ੧੯ ਬਾਲਮੀਕ ਬਟਵਾੜਾ
translation: Valmiki

gurmukhi: ਵਾਟੈ ਮਾਣਸ ਮਾਰਦਾ ਬੈਠਾ ਬਾਲਮੀਕ ਬਟਵਾੜਾ
transliteration: Vaatai Maanas Maaradaa Baitdaa Baalameek Vatavaarhaa.
translation: Valmeel was a highwayman Valmiki who would rob and kill travellers passing by.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਾ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਭੇਟਿਅਾ ਮਨ ਵਿਚਿ ਹੋਅਾ ਖਿੰਜੋਤਾੜਾ
transliteration: Pooraa Satiguru Bhaytiaa Man Vichi Hoaa Khijo Taarhaa.
translation: Then he began serving the true Guru, Now his mind became diffident about his work.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਰਨ ਨੋ ਲੋਚੈ ਘਣਾ ਕਢਿ ਨ ਹੰਘ ਹਥੁ ੳੁਘਾੜਾ
transliteration: Maaran No Lochai Ghanaa Kaddhi N Hanghai Hadu Oughaarhaa.
translation: His mind still urged to kill people but his hands would not obey.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਮਨੂਅਾ ਰਾਖਿਅਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਨ ਅਾਵੈ ੳੁਛੋਹਾੜਾ
transliteration: Satigur Manooaa Raakhiaa Hoi N Aavai Ouchhayhaarhaa.
translation: The true Guru made his mind tranquil and all the volition of mind came to an end.

gurmukhi: ਅੳੁਗੁਣੁ ਸਭ ਪਰਗਾਸਿਅਨੁ ਰੋਜਗਾਰੁ ਹੈ ੲੇਹੁ ਅਸਾੜਾ
transliteration: Aougounu Sabh Paragaasianu Rojagaaru Hai Ayhu Asaarhaa.
translation: He unfolded all the evils of mind before the Guru and said, ‘O Lord, this is a profession for me.’

gurmukhi: ਘਰਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਪੁਛਣ ਘਲਿਅਾ ਅੰਤਕਾਲ ਹੈ ਕੋੲਿ ਅਸਾੜਾ
transliteration: Ghar Vichi Pouchhan Ghaliaa Antikaal Hai Koi Asaarhaa.
translation: The Guru asked him to enquire at home as to which family members would be co-partner him of his evil deeds at death.

gurmukhi: ਕੋੜਮੜਾ ਚੳੁਖੰਨੀਅੈ ਕੋੲਿ ਨ ਬੇਲੀ ਕਰਦੇ ਝਾੜਾ
transliteration: Korhamarhaa Chaoukhanneeai Koi N Baylee Karaday Jhaarhaa.
translation: But although his family were always ready to be sacrifice unto him, none of them were ready to accept responsibility.

gurmukhi: ਸਚੁ ਦ੍ਰਿੜ੍ਹ੍ਹਾੲਿ ੳੁਧਾਰਿਅਨੁ ਟਪਿ ਨਿਕਥਾ ੳੁਪਰ ਵਾੜਾ
transliteration: Sachu Drirhaai Udhaarianu Tapi Nikadaa Oupar Vaarhaa.
translation: On returning, the Guru placed the sermon of truth within his heart and made him a liberated one. With a single leap he was released from the net of worldliness.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਲੰਘੇ ਪਾਪ ਪਹਾੜਾ ||੧੯||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Laghay Paap Pahaarhaa ?19?
translation: Becoming gurmukh, one becomes capable of jumping across mountains of sins.

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਅਜਾਮਲ
translation: Ajamil

gurmukhi: ਪਤਿਤ ਅਜਾਮਲੁ ਪਾਪ ਕਰਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਕਲਾਵਤਣੀ ਦੇ ਰਹਿਅਾ
transliteration: Patitu Ajaamal Paapu Kari Jaai Kalaavatanee Day Rahiaa.
translation: Ajamil, the fallen sinner lived with a prostitute.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਤੇ ਬੇਮੁਖੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੈ ਪਾਪ ਕਮਾਵੈ ਦੁਰਮਤਿ ਦਹਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guru Tay Baymoukhu Hoi Kai Paap Kamaavai Duramati Dahiaa.
translation: He became an apostate. He was entangled in the cobweb of evil deeds.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਰਥਾ ਜਨਮੁ ਗਵਾੲਿਅਨੁ ਭਵਜਲ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਫਿਰਦਾ ਵਹਿਅਾ
transliteration: Biradaa Janamu Gavaaiaa Bhavajal Andari Dhiradaa Vahiaa.
translation: His life was wasted in futile deeds and was tossed and thrown within the terrifying worldly ocean.

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਪੁਤ ਜਾੲੇ ਵੇਸੁਅਾ ਪਾਪਾਂ ਦੇ ਫਲ ੲਿਛੇ ਲਹਿਅਾ
transliteration: Chhia Pout Jaaay Vaysuaa Paapaa Day Phal Ichhay Lahiaa.
translation: While with the prostitute, he became the father of six sons.  As a result of her bad deeds they all became dangerous robbers.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਤੁ ੳੁਪੰਨਾਂ ਸਤਵਾਂ ਨਾੳੁ ਧਰਣ ਨੋ ਚਿਤਿ ੳੁਮਹਿਅਾ
transliteration: Poutu Oupannaan Satavaan Naau Dharan No Chiti Oumahiaa.
translation: A seventh son was born and he began to consider a name for the child.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੂ ਦੁਅਾਰੈ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਨਾੳੁ ਨਰਾੲਿਣੁ ਕਹਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guroo Duaarai Jaai Kai Guramoukhi Naau Naraainu Kahiaa.
translation: He visited the Guru who named his son Narayan (a name for God).

gurmukhi: ਅੰਤਕਾਲ ਜਮਦੂਤ ਵੇਖਿ ਪੁਤ ਨਰਾੲਿਣੁ ਬੋਲੈ ਛਹਿਅਾ
transliteration: Antakaal Jamadoot Vaykhi Pout Naraainu Bolai Chhahiaa.
translation: At the end of his life, seeing the messengers of death Ajamil cried for Narayan.

gurmukhi: ਜਮਗਣ ਮਾਰੇ ਹਰਿ ਜਨਾਂ ਗੲਿਅਾ ਸੁਰਗ ਜਮੁਡੰਡੁ ਨ ਸਹਿਅਾ
transliteration: Jamagan Maaray Hari Janaan Gaiaa Surag Jamu Dandu N Sahiaa.
translation: The name of God made the death messengers take to their heels. Ajamil went to heaven and did not suffer the beatings from the club of the messengers of death.

gurmukhi: ਨਾੲਿ ਲੲੇ ਦੁਖੁ ਡੇਰਾ ਢਹਿਅਾ ||੨੦||
transliteration: Naai Laay Doukhu Dayraa Ddhahiaa ?20?
translation: Utterance of Name of the Lord dispels all sorrow.

gurmukhi: ੨੧ ਗਨਿਕਾ
translation: The Prostitute

gurmukhi: ਗਨਿਕਾ ਪਾਪਣਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੈ ਪਾਪਾਂ ਦਾ ਗਲਿ ਹਾਰੁ ਪਰੋਤਾ
transliteration: Ganikaa Paapani Hoi Kai Paapaan Daa Gali Haaru Parotaa.
translation: Gankaa was a sinful prostitute who wore the necklace of misdeeds around her neck.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾਂ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਅਾਚਾਣਚਕ ਗਨਿਕਾ ਵਾੜੇ ਅਾੲਿ ਖਲੋਤਾ
transliteration: Mahaan Purakh Aachaanachak Ganikaa Vaarh Aai Khalotaa.
translation: Once a great man was passing by who halted in her courtyard.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਰਮਤਿ ਦੇਖਿ ਦੲਿਅਾਲ ਹੋੲਿ ਹਥਹੁੰ ੳੁਸ ਨੋ ਦਿਤੋਨੁ ਤੋਤਾ
transliteration: Duramati Daykhi Daiaalu Hoi Hadahu Ous No Ditonu Totaa.
translation: Seeing her bad plight he became compassionate and offered her a special parrot.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮੁ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਖੇਲਿ ਗੲਿਅਾ ਦੇ ਵਣਜੁ ਸਓਤਾ
transliteration: Raam Naamu Oupadaysu Kari Khayli Gaiaa Day Vanaju Saaotaa.
translation: He told her to teach the parrot to repeat the name of Ram. Having made her understand this fruitful trade he then went away.

gurmukhi: ਲਿਵ ਲਾਗੀ ਤਿਸੁ ਤੋਤਿਅਹੁਂ ਨਿਤ ਪੜ੍ਹਾੲੇ ਕਰੈ ਅਸੋਤਾ
transliteration: Liv Lagee Tisu Totiahu Nit Parhhaaay Karai Asotaa.
translation: Each and every day, with full concentration, she would teach the parrot to say Ram.

gurmukhi: ਪਤਿਤ ੳੁਧਾਰਣੁ ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮੁ ਦੁਰਮਤਿ ਪਾਪ ਕਲੇਵਰੁ ਧੋਤਾ
transliteration: Patitu Udhaaranu Raam Naamu Duramati Paap Kalayvaru Dhotaa.
translation: The name of Lord is the liberator of the fallen ones. It washed away her evil wisdom and deeds.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਤਕਾਲੁ ਜਮ ਜਾਲੁ ਤੋੜਿ ਨਰਕੈ ਵਿਚਿ ਨ ਖਾਧੁਸੁ ਗੋਤਾ
transliteration: Antakaali Jam Jaalu Torhi Narakai Vichi N Khaadhu Su Gotaa.
translation: At the time of death, it cut away the noose of Yama - the messenger of death she did not have to drown in the ocean of hell.

gurmukhi: ਗੲੀ ਬੈਕੁੰਠਿ ਬਿਬਾਣਿ ਚੜ੍ਹਿ ਨਾੳੁ ਨਰਾੲਿਣੁ ਛੋਤਿ ਅਛੋਤਾ
transliteration: Gaee Baikountdi Bibaani Charhhi Naaoun Rasaainu Chhoti Achhotaa.
translation: Due to the elixir of name (of the Lord) she became totally devoid of sins and was lifted to the heavens.

gurmukhi: ਥਾੳੁ ਨਿਥਾਵੇ ਮਾਣੁ ਮਣੋਤਾ ||੨੧||
transliteration: Daaoun Nidaavayn Maanu Manotaa ?21?
translation: The name (of the Lord) is the last refuge of the shelterless ones.

gurmukhi: ੨੨ ਪੂਤਨਾ
translation: Putana

gurmukhi: ਅਾੲੀ ਪਾਪਣਿ ਪੂਤਨਾ ਦੁਹੀ ਥਣੀ ਵਿਹੁ ਲਾੲਿ ਵਹੇਲੀ
transliteration: Aaee Paapani Pootanaa Duhee Danee Vihu Laai Vahaylee.
translation: The ill-reputed Putana applied poison on both of her teats.

gurmukhi: ਅਾੲਿ ਬੈਠੀ ਪਰਵਾਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਨੇਹੁੰ ਲਾੲਿ ਨਵਹਾਣਿ ਨਵੇਲੀ
transliteration: Aai Baitdee Paravaar Vichi Nayhoun Laai Navahaani Navaylee.
translation: She came to the family (of Nand) and started to express her newfound love for the family.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਛੜਿ ਲੲੇ ਗੋਵਿੰਦ ਰਾੲਿ ਕਰਿ ਚੇਟਕ ਚਤੁਰੰਗ ਮਹੇਲੀ
transliteration: Kouchharhi Laay Govind Raai Kari Chaytaku Chaturang Mahaylee.
translation: Through her clever deception, she lifted Krishna in her lap.

gurmukhi: ਮੋਹਣੁ ਮੰਮੇ ਪਾੲਿਓਨੁ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਅਾੲੀ ਗਰਬ ਗਹੇਲੀ
transliteration: Mohanu Manmay Paaiaonu Baahari Aaee Garab Gahaylee.
translation: With great pride she pressed her breast teat in the mouth of Krishna and came out.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਹ ਵਧਾੲਿ ੳੁਚਾੲਿਅਨੁ ਤਿਹ ਚਰਿਅਾਰਿ ਨਾਰਿ ਅਠਿਖੇਲੀ
transliteration: Dayh Vadhaai Ouchaaianu Tih Chariaari Naari Atdikhaylee.
translation: Now she expanded her body to a great extent.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਹੁੰ ਲੋਅਾਂ ਦਾ ਭਾਰੁ ਦੇ ਚੰਬੜਿਅਾ ਗਲਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਦੁਹੇਲੀ
transliteration: Tihoun Loaan Daa Bhaaru Day Chanbarhiaa Gali Hoi Duhaylee.
translation: Krishna also becoming the full weight of the three worlds hung from and stuck to her neck.

gurmukhi: ਖਾੲਿ ਪਛਾੜ ਪਹਾੜ ਵਾਂਗਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਪੲੀ ਓਜਾੜਿ ਧਕੇਲੀ
transliteration: Khaai Pachhaarh Pahaarh Vaangi Jaai Paee Ujaarhi Dhakaylee.
translation: Getting unconscious, and like a mountain she fell down into the forest.

transliteration: Keetee Maaoo Tuli Sahaylee ?22?
translation: Krishna liberated her at last and gave her status of equal to his mother’s friend.

gurmukhi: ੨੩ ਬੱਧਕ ਦਾ ਪ੍ਰਸੰਗ
translation: Demise of krsna at the hands of a hunter

gurmukhi: ਜਾੲਿ ਸੁਤਾ ਪਰਭਾਸ ਵਿਚਿ ਗੋਡੇ ੳੁਤੇ ਪੈਰ ਪਸਾਰੇ
transliteration: Jaai Soutaa Parabhaas Vichi Goday Outay Pair Pasaaray.
translation: At the sacred place of Prabhas, Krishna slept cross legged with his foot on his knee.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਮਲ ਵਿਚਿ ਪਦਮੁ ਹੈ ਝਿਲਮਿਲ ਝਲਕੈ ਵਾਂਗੀ ਤਾਰੇ
transliteration: Charan Kaval Vichi Padamu Hai Jhilamil Jhalakay Vaangee Taaray.
translation: The lotus sign in his foot was illuminating like a star.

gurmukhi: ਬਧਿਕੁ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਭਾਲਦਾ ਮਿਰਗੈ ਜਾਣਿ ਬਾਣੁ ਲੈ ਮਾਰੇ
transliteration: Badhaku Aaiaa Bhaaladaa Miragai Jaani Baanu Lai Maaray.
translation: A hunter came and considering it an eye of a deer, shot the arrow.

gurmukhi: ਦਰਸਨ ਡਿਠੋਸੁ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਕਰਣ ਪਲਾਵ ਕਰੇ ਪੂਕਾਰੇ
transliteration: Darasan Ditdosu Jaai Kai Karan Palaav Karay Poukaaray.
translation: As he approached, he realised it was Krishna. He became full of sorrow and begged forgiveness.

gurmukhi: ਗਲਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਲੀਤਾ ਕ੍ਰਿਸ਼ਨ ਜੀ ਅਵਗੁਣੁ ਕੀਤਾ ਹਰਿ ਨਾ ਚਿਤਾਰੇ
transliteration: Gali Vichi Leetaa Krisan Jee Avagounu Keetaa Hari N Chitaaray.
translation: Krishna ignored his wrong act and embraced him.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਿ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਸੰਤੋਖਿਅਾ ਪਤਿਤ ੳੁਧਾਰਣੁ ਬਿਰਦੁ ਬੀਚਾਰੇ
transliteration: Kari Kirapaa Santokhiaa Patit Udhaaranu Biradu Beechaaray.
translation: Gracefully Krishna asked him to be full of perseverance and gave sactuary to the wrongdoer.

gurmukhi: ਭਲੇ ਭਲੇ ਕਰਿ ਮੰਨੀਅਨਿ ਬੁਰਿਅਾਂ ਦੇ ਹਰਿ ਕਾਜ ਸਵਾਰੇ
transliteration: Bhalay Bhalay Kari Manneeani Buriaan Day Hari Kaaj Savaaray.
translation: The good is said good by everyone but the works of the evil doers are set right by the Lord only.

transliteration: Paap Karaynday Patit Udhaaray ?23?10?
translation: He has liberated many fallen sinners.

gurmukhi: ਦਸਮ ਸਥਾਨ ਕੇ ਸਮਾਨਿ ਕੳੁਨ ਭੳੁਨ ਕਹਓ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪਾਵੈ ਸੁ ਤੳੁ ਅਨਤ ਨ ਪਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Dasam Sadaan Kay Samaani Kaoun Bhaoun Kahaao , Gurmukhi Paavai Su Tau Anat N Paavaee ?
translation: What other place of mystic abode can I say than the tenth concealed opening of a human being? Only the Guru conscious person can reach it by the grace of True Guru by meditating on His name.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਨਮਨੀ ਜੋਤਿ ਪਟੰਤਰ ਦੀਜੈ ਕੳੁਨ ਜੋਤਿ ਦੲਿਅਾ ਕੈ ਦਿਖਾਵੈ ਜਾਹੀ ਤਾਹੀ ਬਨਿ ਅਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Ounamanee Joti Patantar Deejai Kaoun Joti , Daiaa Kai Dikhaavai Jaahee Taahee Bani Aavaee ?
translation: What light can be equated with the radiance one receives at the time of spiritual enlightenment?

gurmukhi: ਅਨਹਦ ਨਾਦ ਸਮਸਰਿ ਨਾਦ ਬਾਦ ਕਓਨ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਗੁਰ ਸੁਨਾਵੇ ਜਾਹਿ ਸੋੲੀ ਲਿਵ ਲਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Anahad Naad Samasari Naad Baad Kaaona , Sree Gur Sounaavay Jaahi Soee Liv Laavaee ?
translation: What melodious musical sound can be equal to the melodious unstruck musical sound of divine word?

gurmukhi: ਨਿਝਰ ਅਪਾਰ ਧਾਰ ਤੁਲਿ ਨ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਰਸ ਅਪਿਓ ਪੀਅਾਵੈ ਜਾਹਿ ਤਾਹੀ ਮੈ ਸਮਾਵੲੀ ||੨||੧੦||
transliteration: Nijhar Apaar Dhaar Tuli N Anmrit Rasa , Apiao Peeaavai Jaahi Taahee Mai Samaavaee ?2?10?
translation: There is no other elixir capable of making one immortal than the one that flows perpetually in the concealed opening (Dasam Duar) of a human being. And one who is blessed by the True Guru (Satguru) to receive this elixir of immortality obtains it by His g
